title: Virginia Chadwyck-Healey on dressing for holidays in the British countryside
text:
I have been looking forward to writing this column for a while. The reason being that this brand reminds me of one thing: holidays. Not sunny beaches and Aperol spritz-type holidays but instead trips north to the Highlands of Scotland with our best friends. Days upon days of cooked breakfasts, card games, fishing, Tunnocks Caramel Wafers, the open expanses of rolling hills... and one revered shopping excursion.

A trip to Campbell's of Beauly is always on the agenda and in the past has resulted in a new cashmere cardigan for our first daughter (in the days when we thought this was a good idea, and then realised the need for machine-washable items only), umpteen pairs of socks for the male members...
